title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
A federal judge overturned a roughly $4.5 billion settlement between Purdue Pharma and members of the Sackler family who own the drugmaker.

Former McDonald's CEO Easterbrook agreed to return compensation now valued at over $105 million to resolve a legal dispute related to his dismissal as head of the firm.

A sharp fall in tech shares pushed major U.S. stock indexes lower. The S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow fell 0.9%, 2.5% and 0.1%, respectively.

FedEx posted a 14% increase in revenue for its fiscal second quarter, as higher rates helped offset rising costs from labor shortages.

Prosecutors in the criminal-fraud trial of Theranos founder Holmes stated their case once more in closing arguments Thursday.

Meta Platforms said it removed about 1,500 Facebook and Instagram accounts that it linked to groups it called "cyber mercenaries."

Bruce Springsteen sold his music rights to Sony Music for between $500 million and $600 million.

What's News: Business & Finance
